Context:
EXTRACTED INFORMATION:
- Our career-focused programs help students graduate with academic credentials and necessary skills for the modern workplace (no specific duration mentioned)
- Students can choose from a large number of diploma/certificate programs which are 1, 2 or 3 academic years in duration, and most have start dates in September and/or January.
- Graduate certificates are postgraduate programs offered for students who have already graduated from a university or college, and they are 8- or 12-month long, highly specialized programs designed to give graduates advanced skills in a specific professional field.
- Degree programs are four-year Bachelor Degree programs offered in Financial Services, Hospitality, Construction Management, Early Childhood Development, Behaviour Analysis, and Interpretation.
- George Brown College offers an English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program which is a full-time program divided into 9 levels of 8 weeks each, and most students study for 6-10 months. It prepares students for further academic study at the college and allows applicants from eligible countries to apply for conditional admission to George Brown's postsecondary programs.
- The text mentions various industries like Financial Services, Hospitality, Construction Management, Early Childhood Development, Behaviour Analysis, Interpretation, and ESL.
- Industry partners work with the college to make sure that programs are current and cutting edge.
- Students can search for programs by keyword or job title, and filter by school name and by domestic or international availability.
